required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Cytokine Profiling of Cardiac Transplant Recipients

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: Measurement of cytokine levels in post-cardiac transplant patients with unexplained graft dysfunction.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences in cytokine profiles between stable heart transplant recipients and those with acute rejection
primary_outcome.description: Differences in cytokine profiles between stable heart transplant recipients and those with acute rejection

arm_group.description: Heart Transplant Recipients with Unexplained Graft Dysfunction
Heart Transplant Recipients with Normal Graft Function

study_pop.textblock: Cardiology Clinic and inpatient service. Normal controls are volunteers from within the community.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Group 1
- 18 years and older
- Cardiac Transplant recipient with graft dysfunction of unknown etiology
Group 2
- 18 years or older
- No history of heart failure or cardiac transplantation Group 3
- 18 years or older
- Class II-IV heart failure Group 4
- 18 years or older
- Heart Transplant 6 months or greater prior to blood draw
- No graft dysfunction
Exclusion Criteria:
Group 1 Heart Transplant with Unexplained Graft Dysfunction
- Cellular or antibody-mediated cardiac allograft dysfunction
Group 2 Normal Control group
- Active infection within 1 month of blood draw
- Known Inflammatory Disease
Group 3 Heart Failure Group
- Active infection within 1 month of blood draw
- Known Inflammatory Disease
Group 4 Heart Transplant with Normal Graft Function Group
- Active infection within 1 month of blood draw
- Known graft dysfunction
- Known Inflammatory Disease

overall_official.affiliation: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute
